1. This sign indicates:
2. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
3. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 4. When your wheels slip off the road edge, you should:
column4: slow down using the brakes gently. When at a safe speed, turn the steering wheel to return to the pavement.
column6: speed up and steer back onto the pavement gradually.
column8: jerk the steering wheel to force the vehicle back onto the pavement.
column10: slam on your brakes and stop.

column2: 5. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column8: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 8. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 9. Signs and markings requiring that you obey the indicated instruction are known as _____ signs.
10. Drivers may install on their private vehicle:
column6: a muffler cutout, bypass, or similar device.
column8: a blue light visible outside of the vehicle.

column2: 21. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
22. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column6: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column8: pull over to the right and stop.
column10: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 25. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 26. When driving a vehicle upon any public street or highway, you must:
column4: show your driver’s license upon demand.

column2: 27. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 28. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
29. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: wait for the next green light.

column2: 30. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: move into the left lane of a multilane road.
column6: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.
column8: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.
